title: Danny Elfman
summary: Daniel Robert Elfman (born May 29, 1953) is an American composer, singer, and songwriter. He came to prominence as the singer-songwriter for the new wave band Oingo Boingo in the early 1980s.[4] Since the 1990s, Elfman has garnered international recognition for composing over 100 feature film scores,[5] as well as compositions for television, stage productions, and the concert hall.
